name: Ejisu Palace
description: A historic landmark offering insights into the local heritage and traditions of the Ashanti Kingdom.

name: Ejisu Central Market
description: A bustling market where you can experience local commerce, find fresh produce, textiles, and traditional crafts.

name: Ejisu Community Park
description: A serene green space perfect for relaxation, family picnics, and community gatherings.

name: Manhyia Palace Museum (Kumasi - nearby)
description: Though in Kumasi, it's a significant cultural site nearby, showcasing the history and artifacts of the Ashanti kingdom.

name: Kejetia Market (Kumasi - nearby)
description: West Africa's largest open-air market, a vibrant hub of activity offering everything from food to electronics.

name: Lake Bosomtwe (nearby)
description: Ghana's only natural lake, a popular site for recreation, surrounded by lush hills and charming villages.

name: Kumasi Zoo (Kumasi - nearby)
address: Ashanti New Town Rd, Kumasi, Ghana
description: Home to a variety of local and exotic animals, a great educational and recreational spot.

name: Bonwire Kente Village (nearby)
description: The birthplace of Kente cloth, where you can see weavers at work and purchase authentic traditional textiles.
